interfaces

Interface Calendar

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CalendarImpl

    public interface Calendar
    This interface specifies a calendar that can create, store and exchange Appointments (which themselves can have Comments) with other instances using a network connection. Once an Appointment was created, it can be send to all known Users (that were once added), likewise Appointments can be received from other Calendars. This also applies to Appointments (and their Comments) that were just received from others and not created by the current instance. Therefore, every Appointment is (potentially) public and, accordingly, Users should only be added when trusted. The Calendar works as a facade to all other classes, instances of Appointment, User and Comment can not be created without it and are bound to the Calendar's persistence layer.
    See Also:
    Appointment, Comment, User

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCommentToAppointment(java.lang.String content, Appointment appointment)
      This method adds a new Comment with this Calendar's owner as creator to the passed Appointment.
      Appointment createAppointment(java.lang.String topic, java.util.Date start, long duration, java.lang.String location, java.lang.String description)
      This method creates and returns an Appointment with the passed topic, start date, duration, location and description.
      User createUser(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String email, java.net.URI host)
      This method creates a new known User for this Calendar.
      java.util.Collection<Appointment> getAllAppointments(boolean sorted)
      This method returns all Appointments of this Calendar, optionally sorted by their start date.
      java.util.Collection<User> getAllUsers()
      This method returns all known users of this Calendar.
      java.util.Collection<Appointment> getAppointments(java.lang.String topic, User creator, java.util.Date start, long duration, java.lang.String location, boolean sorted)
      This method returns the Appointments of this Calendar, filtered by the passed arguments.
      java.util.Collection<Appointment> getAppointmentsByCreator(User creator, boolean sorted)
      This method returns the Appointments of this Calendar were created by the specifies User.
      java.util.Collection<Appointment> getAppointmentsByLocation(java.lang.String location_name, boolean sorted)
      This method returns the Appointments of this Calendar with the specified location, optionally sorted by their start date.
      java.util.Collection<Appointment> getAppointmentsByTime(java.util.Date start, long duration_ms)
      This method returns this Calendars Appointments with the passed start date.

      This method returns a Collection containing all Appointments with the passed topic, optionally sorted by their start date.

      This method returns the User with the passed email address that is stored as a known user in this Calendar.

      This method checks whether a known user with the passed email address exists in this Calendar.

    • Method Detail

      • getAppointmentsByTopic

        java.util.Collection<Appointment> getAppointmentsByTopic(java.lang.String topic,
                                                         boolean sorted)
        This method returns a Collection containing all Appointments with the passed topic, optionally sorted by their start date.
        Parameters:
        topic - the topic the returned Appointments belong to, if set to null the topic will not be used as a filter
        sorted - true if the returned Appointments should be sorted by their start date, false otherwise
        Returns:
        the (optionally sorted) Collection of Appointments with the passed topic
        See Also:
        Appointment

      • getAppointmentsByTime

        java.util.Collection<Appointment> getAppointmentsByTime(java.util.Date start,
                                                        long duration_ms)
        This method returns this Calendars Appointments with the passed start date.
        Parameters:
        start - the start date the Appointments are requested have, ignored as a filter when set to null
        duration_ms - the duration of the Appointment, not relevant as a filter
        Returns:
        the (unsorted) Collection of Appointments with the specified start date
        See Also:
        Appointment

      • getAppointmentsByLocation

        java.util.Collection<Appointment> getAppointmentsByLocation(java.lang.String location_name,
                                                            boolean sorted)
        This method returns the Appointments of this Calendar with the specified location, optionally sorted by their start date.
        Parameters:
        location_name - the String specifying the location of the returned Appointments
        sorted - true if the returned Appointments should be sorted by their start date, false otherwise
        Returns:
        a Collection holding the Appointments with the specified location
        See Also:
        Appointment

      • getAppointmentsByCreator

        java.util.Collection<Appointment> getAppointmentsByCreator(User creator,
                                                           boolean sorted)
        This method returns the Appointments of this Calendar were created by the specifies User.
        Parameters:
        creator - the User that created the Appointments that are returned, if null the creator is ignored
        sorted - true if the returned Appointments should be sorted by their start date, false otherwise
        Returns:
        the Appointments created by the specified creator
        See Also:
        Appointment, User

      • getAllAppointments

        java.util.Collection<Appointment> getAllAppointments(boolean sorted)
        This method returns all Appointments of this Calendar, optionally sorted by their start date.
        Parameters:
        sorted - true if the returned Appointments should be sorted by their start date, false otherwise
        Returns:
        the Appointments stored by this Calendar instance
        See Also:
        Appointment

      • getAppointments

        java.util.Collection<Appointment> getAppointments(java.lang.String topic,
                                                  User creator,
                                                  java.util.Date start,
                                                  long duration,
                                                  java.lang.String location,
                                                  boolean sorted)
        This method returns the Appointments of this Calendar, filtered by the passed arguments.
        Parameters:
        topic - the topic of the returned Appointments, if null the topic is ignored
        creator - the User that created the returned Appointments, if null the creator is ignored
        start - the start date of the returned Appointments, if null the start date is ignored
        duration - the duration of the Appointments, ignored by the lookup query
        location - the location of the returned Appointments, if null the location is ignored
        sorted - true if the returned Appointments should be sorted by their start date, false otherwise
        Returns:
        the Appointments of this Calendar that match the passed arguments
        See Also:
        Appointment

      • hasAppointments

        boolean hasAppointments()
        Returns whether one or more Appointments are stored in this Calendar
        Returns:
        true if this Calendar stores one or more Appointments, false otherwise

      • removeAppointment

        void removeAppointment(Appointment appointment)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method removes the passed Appointment from this Calendar. Note that this does not cause removal of the Appointment from other Calendar instances it was possibly transfered to and that the passed Appointment is invalid after removal and should not be used anymore.
        Parameters:
        appointment - the Appointment that will be removed from this Calendar and should not be used afterwards
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case the passed Appointment is invalid
        See Also:
        Appointment

      • createAppointment

        Appointment createAppointment(java.lang.String topic,
                              java.util.Date start,
                              long duration,
                              java.lang.String location,
                              java.lang.String description)
                       throws CalendarException,
                              java.io.IOException
        This method creates and returns an Appointment with the passed topic, start date, duration, location and description. The creator of this Appointment is determined by this Calendar's owner. Note that the arguments apart from duration and description (empty String allowed) must not be null or empty.
        Parameters:
        topic - the String specifies the topic of the Appointment
        start - the Date specifying the start date of the Appointment
        duration - the duration in milliseconds of the Appointment
        location - the location of the Appointment
        description - the description of the Appointment
        Returns:
        the Appointment that was created
        Throws:
        CalendarException - in case of an error when internally storing the Appointment
        java.io.IOException - in case of an connection error when trying to transfer the Appointment
        See Also:
        Appointment

      • addCommentToAppointment

        void addCommentToAppointment(java.lang.String content,
                             Appointment appointment)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             java.io.IOException,
                             CalendarException
        This method adds a new Comment with this Calendar's owner as creator to the passed Appointment.
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the Comment
        appointment - the Appointment the created Comment is attached to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case the passed content is empty or null
        java.io.IOException - in case of a connection error
        CalendarException - in case of an internal error when trying to store the Comment
        See Also:
        Comment, Appointment

      • createUser

        User createUser(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String email,
                java.net.URI host)
         throws CalendarException
        This method creates a new known User for this Calendar. The user is identified by its email address which therefore has to be unique for each user. Known users can automatically receive and transfer Appointments and Comments to and from this Calendar so this function should be used with care.
        Parameters:
        name - the String specifying the name of the new User
        email - the (unique) email address of the new User
        host - the URI at which a connection to the new User can be established
        Returns:
        the User that was created
        Throws:
        CalendarException - in case of an internal error when trying to store the User
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the arguments is considered invalid (e.g. an already existing email address)
        See Also:
        User

      • removeUser

        void removeUser(java.lang.String email)
         throws CalendarException,
                java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method removes the User that is identified with the passed email address from this calendar.
        Parameters:
        email - the email address that identifies the User that is going to be removed
        Throws:
        CalendarException - in case of an internal error when trying to remove the user
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case a user with the specified email does not exist
        See Also:
        User

      • removeUser

        void removeUser(User user)
         throws CalendarException
        This method removes the passed User from this calendar.
        Parameters:
        user - the User that will be removed from this Calendar
        Throws:
        CalendarException - in case of an internal error when trying to remove the user
        See Also:
        User

      • getUser

        User getUser(java.lang.String email)
      throws CalendarException,
             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method returns the User with the passed email address that is stored as a known user in this Calendar.
        Parameters:
        email - the String representing the email address of the user
        Returns:
        the User having the specified email address
        Throws:
        CalendarException - in case of an internal error when trying to retrieve the User
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case a User with the passed email address does not exist
        See Also:
        User

      • getAllUsers

        java.util.Collection<User> getAllUsers()
        This method returns all known users of this Calendar.
        Returns:
        all known users of this Calendar
        See Also:
        User

      • userExists

        boolean userExists(java.lang.String email)
            throws CalendarException
        This method checks whether a known user with the passed email address exists in this Calendar.
        Parameters:
        email - the email address specifying the User
        Returns:
        true if this Calendar contains a User with the passed email address, false otherwise
        Throws:
        CalendarException - in case an internal error when trying to check the User

      • sendAndReceiveAppointments

        void sendAndReceiveAppointments()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        A call to this method explicitly tries to send Appointments to and receive Appointments from other Calendar instances that are owned by known users.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of a connection error

      • registerAppointmentListener

        void registerAppointmentListener(ChangedAppointmentListener handler)
        This method registers a ChangedAppointmentListener that listens for an Appointment that was created or one for which a Comment was added.
        Parameters:
        handler - the ChangedAppointmentListener that is going to be called when a new Appointment was created or a Comment was added to an existing one
        See Also:
        ChangedAppointmentListener
